description: MongoBouncer Overview - Complete monitoring of MongoDB connection pooling proxy with all available metrics

panels.description: This metric checks the availability status of mongobouncer, an important MongoD component responsible for connection pooling, ensuring system stability by monitoring its uptime.
panels.title: MongoBouncer Status

panels.description: Server connections that are linked to a client.
panels.title: Clients Active

panels.description: Total number of database connections created with downstream MongoDBs
panels.title: Current conn on DB

panels.description: Maximum connections to the downstream MongoDBs
panels.title: Max Pool Connections

panels.description: Maximum number of allowed connections per job. 0 is unlimited
panels.title: Max Client Conn

panels.description: Tracks the total number of isMaster (hello) commands sent to MongoDB servers, which are used to check server availability and role in the cluster.
panels.title: isMaster Commands

panels.description: Shows the current number of active client sessions, helping you monitor how many users or applications are actively connected.
panels.title: Active Sessions

panels.description: End-to-end time handling an incoming request from the application (P95) for successful and unsuccessful queries
panels.title: Request Duration

panels.description: Total number of queries pooled by mongobouncer
panels.title: Total Queries

panels.description: Counts how many times connections are returned to the pool, showing how efficiently connections are being reused.
panels.title: Total Check-ins

panels.description: Counts how many times connections are taken from the pool, reflecting demand from your application.
panels.title: Total Check-outs

panels.description: Shows the total number of open and closed connections across all MongoBouncer instances, giving you a cluster-wide view of active connections.
panels.title: Client Connections

panels.description: Shows the rate of open and closed connections across all MongoBouncer instances, giving you a cluster-wide view of active connections.
panels.title: Client Connections Rate

panels.description: Average time spent waiting for a server to return a query response. Includes time spent waiting for an available connection.
panels.title: Queries Duration

panels.description: Tracks the total TCP/network connections between clients and the MongoBouncer proxy
panels.title: Total Opened Connections

panels.description: Tracks the current open TCP/network connections between clients and the MongoBouncer proxy
panels.title: Current Open Connections

panels.description: Counts the total number of client requests handled by MongoBouncer, helping you monitor overall traffic and workload trends.
panels.title: Request Rate

panels.description: Request throughput by operation
panels.title: Request Throughput

panels.description: Shows the number of connections currently in use from the pool, helping you monitor real-time demand on your connection pool.
panels.title: Pool Active Connections

panels.description: Shows the total number of connections (both active and idle) in the pool, helping you track overall pool size and capacity.
panels.title: Pool Total Connections

panels.description: Shows how much of the connection pool is in use, helping you see if your pool is under- or over-utilized.
panels.title: Pool Utilization Ratio

panels.description: Total volume in bytes of network traffic sent / received by mongobouncer
panels.title: Network Traffic

panels.description: Shows the 95th percentile time it takes to check out a connection from the pool managed by MongoBouncer over the last 5 minutes, highlighting slower-than-usual waits that affect a small portion of requests.
panels.title: Pool Checkout Duration

panels.description: Shows the 95th percentile time it takes to check out a connection from the actual MongoDB pool, indicating the connection wait time
panels.title: MongoDB Connection Checkout Duration

panels.description: Average time spent (P95) waiting for a server to return a query response. Includes time spent waiting for a connection to become available.
panels.title: Queries Duration

panels.description: Counts how many times connections are taken from the pool, reflecting demand from your application.
panels.title: Pool Checkout Total

panels.description: Counts how many times connections are returned to the pool, showing how efficiently connections are being reused.
panels.title: Pool Checkin Total

panels.description: Counts how many times attempts to check out a connection from the pool have failed, helping you detect pool exhaustion or configuration issues.
panels.title: Pool Checkout Failures

panels.description: Counts the total number of errors encountered by MongoBouncer, helping you spot issues affecting requests or connections
panels.title: Errors

panels.description: Counts all connection pool events (such as creation, closure, or errors), giving visibility into pool activity and potential issues.
panels.title: Pool Events Rate

panels.description: Tracks how often isMaster (hello) commands are sent per second over the last 5 minutes, showing the frequency of server status checks and topology discovery.
panels.title: IsMaster Rate

panels.description: Shows the total number of active cursors across all MongoBouncer instances, helping you track how many queries are currently being iterated.
panels.title: Active Cursors

panels.description: Shows the rate of the number of opened vs closed cursors across all MongoBouncer instances
panels.title: Cursor Rates

panels.description: Shows the total number of active transactions across all MongoBouncer instances, helping you monitor ongoing workload and spot long-running transactions.
panels.title: Active Transactions

panels.description: Shows the rate of the number of committed vs aborted transactions across all MongoBouncer instances
panels.title: Transcation Rates

title: MongoBouncer Overview
